Module io.inverno.mod.configuration
Package io.inverno.mod.configuration.source

Class DefaultCompositeConfigurationStrategy

java.lang.Object
io.inverno.mod.configuration.source.DefaultCompositeConfigurationStrategy
All Implemented Interfaces:
CompositeConfigurationStrategy
public class DefaultCompositeConfigurationStrategy extends Object implements CompositeConfigurationStrategy

Default CompositeConfigurationStrategy implementation.

This strategy prioritizes sources in the order in which they have been set in the composite configuration source from the highest priority to the lowest.

It determines the best matching result for a given original query by prioritizing query parameters from left to right: the best matching property is the one matching the most continuous parameters from right to left. If we consider query key property[p1=v1,...pn=vn], it supersedes key property[p2=v2,...pn=vn] which supersedes key property[p3=v3,...pn=vn]... which supersedes key property[].

As a result, an original query with n parameters results in n+1 queries being populated in the source query when no previous result exists from previous sources and n-p queries when there was a previous result with p parameters. A query is then resolved when a result exactly matching the original query is found.

The order into which parameters are defined in the original query is then significant: property[p1=v1,p2=v2] != property[p2=v2,p1=v1].

Since:
1.0
Author:
Jeremy Kuhn

    • populateSourceQuery

      public ExecutableConfigurationQuery<?,?,?> populateSourceQuery(ConfigurationKey queryKey, ConfigurationQuery<?,?,?> sourceQuery, ConfigurationProperty<?,?> previousResult)
      Description copied from interface: CompositeConfigurationStrategy

      Populates the source query created by a composite source to query one of its sources to retrieves values for the specified original query.

      This method takes the previous result retained from previous sources into account to filter out queries that can't possibly supersedes it.

      Specified by:
      populateSourceQuery in interface CompositeConfigurationStrategy
      Parameters:
      queryKey - the configuration key representing the original query
      sourceQuery - the source query
      previousResult - the previous result
      Returns:
      a populated executable configuration query
